reviews.title: First trip to Cuba- relax and enjoy!
reviews.text: We travelled the week of Feb 15-22. I had been reading reviews on here before we left and got really worried from what people had said. I had pretty much no expectations because I thought it was going to be horrible. That wasn't the case. Please don't listen to the reviews and just enjoy Cuba. We stayed overnight in Toronto at the Fairfield Inn and suites. That place was great. Awesome room. Would totally stay there again next time we go somewhere.

reviews.title: Allegro is a no-no
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Cuba and I travelled with my husband and our 2 1/2 year old. Flight was good with Sunwing, no problems there. We were first to board on the plane in Toronto (because we were the only ones on our plane with a toddler) and they even managed to get us seats together on the plane (because we didn't prebook). Although at the airport after getting there 3 hours before they told us to get there earlier. On the plane they gave my daughter a little bag with activities.

reviews.title: worst trip ever, been to alot of places. this was the first time to hell!!!
reviews.text: Arrived in Cuba and everyone was wearing hygiene masks. Had to fill out a paper on the plane to say you were healthy or not. Got our luggage and got on the bus. Weather was great when we arrived. Go to the hotel and check in was very slow. One receptionist for a whole bunch of people. Check in is at 3pm. We arrived around 12:30pm and was told the room would be ready at 3pm. We went to eat at the buffet and walked around. Washrooms by the main bar are gross. They are smelly and no toilet paper and broken locks on doors. Went back to check if room was ready at 3:20pm. Not ready. Went back at 4:00pm and still it wasn't ready. We were told another 20 minutes. We sat out daughter on the counter and let her play there, I complained about how tired and was, having been up at 4am and wanted a room. More complaining and less then 5 minutes later we were given a room key.

reviews.title: Very happy with our trip and would definately stay here again
reviews.text: We stayed in the main building on the 2nd floor in a corner room and we were blown away when we opened the room. It had a separate room with a queen bed and on the other side of the wall had a twin bed! It was perfect for us. We though we were getting one room with 2 beds so this was great. My daughter had her own room at night. If you are a family ask to get a corner room! When we were leaving we talked to a couple that had just arrived and said they did research and it was one of the only hotels that had rooms like that. Good to know!) We had some ants in our room but next time maybe we'll bring an ant trap.

reviews.title: Wait for repairs & improvements
reviews.text: They have a store in the resort that has everything you need if you forget something. We bought a bucket of beach toys and a beach bag and flip flops. They had shampoos, shoes, food, trinkets, rum for really cheap. If you forget something don't worry. You can buy it there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will first start off by saying that if you have booked this hotel dont panick! I read the reviews AFTER I had booked and I nearly had a heart attack. The resort is not alll that bad. I do notice that the more recent reviews have gotten much better, so im thinking that the new management are making good changes. Sorry this is a long review.
reviews.title: Good and Bad

reviews.text: So heres my review. Got to the hotel okay. Check in was fast (we were first off the bus). It was around 11am but our room was ready for us. The bell boy got us and drove us waaaaayyyy to the last door of the last building. We get in the room...its so dark and gloomy. No cushion on the couch, no lamp shades on the lamps, no pot in the coffee maker. It gets worse...we look out onto the balcony....our view is of a service road and some bushes. It does not feel like a vacation if u arent at least overlooking the pool or something. Its been a long day my boyfriend goes to use the washroom and have a shower before we go back to the desk. The toilet doesnt work well at all, you flush it with a string and it will take 2-3 times to get everything down. The shower had no cold water coming out, so he had A HOT shower.
reviews.title: First vacation, wonderful experience, March 22-29 2010

reviews.text: So we walk to front desk...its not super long walk but enough to irritate you. They arent busy. We look at the girl and tell her whats wrong. This girl was not interested at all. Im thinking they get these complaints all the time cause you could just see her face change instantly. She say I cant do anything come back tommorow. Luckily the girl who actually checked us in walked over and asked what was going on. I dont know if she is newer or just happier but thank god for her. She right away started looking at the sheets and got on the phone. She comes back and says that a room in the main building has just been vacated, its ocean view but it is consided an upgrade which will cost us and extra 100 for the week....well worth it! She let us go up and look at it (the maid hadnt cleaned it yet) it was 10 times better. We took it. I swear if I had to have stayed in that other room the whole week I would have been so depressed. So heres my first tip. Just pay a bit more and book ocean view and request the main building. Save yourself the pain. We gave that girl 10 bucks and she was so happy. She helped us with a few other problems we had during the week as well fter that.
reviews.title: My first trip anywhere.... Not a bad start

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay im gonna shorten this review. The room thing was the main issue we had. So if u can just get the better room you will have a better vacation. The food...well. It wasnt terrible we had enough to fill our bellies. It did get repetatvive and there will be some days that u get irritated...but its not gonna ruin your time there. Bring ketchup for sure, maybe salad dressing, spices...if you can. Warning...if u bring ketchup, hide it after you use it. A fellow vacationer nearly squeezed half the ketchup out for her kids. There were no people getting sick that I heard of. Be careful of the snack bar, they serve hambergers and hot dogs through out the day and sometimes it doesnt look to clean. The al acarte were okay. Its a nice change from the buffet, but some of the food is the same as the buffet. Also you can book 3 days in advace to eat at the restaraunts....you dont have to get up eaveryday to reserve a spot.
reviews.title: Okay hotel, not to many complaints. NO SAND FLEA'S!!

reviews.text: Beach was great, pools were good. They could use more chairs at the beach, but just sit on the sand if u have too. The disco was really awesome a couple of the nights lots of dancing people. Dont be scared to go in there even if its just a small group of you. You have to motivate people to go in, if no one goes in then no one else will. The wasrooms at the beach and pool sometimes had toilet paper sometimes not. The nightlife sucked often. The shows were okay the first time, then after you realized its the same dnacers wearing the same kinda things doing the same kinda dances. They just change the themes everynight. And yeah little kids might not wanna see bare bums all the time.
reviews.title: Great Vacation Nicely Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was previously called Oasis 1920 and it had some really bad reviews. Recently a new management was appointed. This might have changed things. And heh this is Cuba!! What more do you expect from a Cuba 3-star hotel? It is clean, the service is excellent, the gardens are beautiful, there are 3 swimming pools, entertainment for the kids and a clean beach with a lot of things to do. And the food is good. Really, the food is good and plenty to choose from. Just forget about all the other reviews. Yes, a small tip (let’s say 1 Euro) now and then helps to indeed get this little bit extra service. But it would help you to walk a bit faster if you would only earn a salary of Euro 12 per months. Cuba is nice and this hotel is nice. Go and check it out yourself!!
reviews.title: Forget about all the other reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read all the reviews before we stayed there and I brushed them off because some people can be pretty harsh. Needless to say, I can understand the negative reviews. Getting into Cuba and through customs was a breeze, no sweat at all, took all of 5 minutes to get through and onto our bus. The resort is only about 30 minutes from the airport and the drivers are great. Check in wasn't bad, it was about 2am when we got there. There is a bar in the reception area but it is never open, which is too bad because a welcome drink would have been nice. The resort is too big, luckily bellhops are usually available to drive you and your luggage to your room, make sure you've got a couple bucks to tip. The first room we had was huge and about a kilometre away from reception. No drawers in the room so you will be living out of your suitcase. There were no lights in the hallways where our room was so we blindly made it back to reception to switch rooms, we wanted to be a little more central. After being told to come back twice we finally got a different room, with two double beds.
reviews.title: Not a 4 star yet, solid 3 though

reviews.text: The buffet: some people say that it doesn't matter what the food is like because you will always find something to eat, that may be true but undercooked hamburgers and rice every single night is not much fun. Stick to the pasta for dinner and the omelet bar for breakfast, oh and the orange juice, it's fantastic.
reviews.title: Had an awesome time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The a la carts: we didn't waste our time in the hour long lines for fear of not getting a chair on the beach, 503 rooms(approx 1000 people) and maybe 200 beach chairs.
reviews.title: Okay - can-do but looking elsewhere

reviews.text: The beach is nice, it's located between two points so if it's windy you can expect a "red flag" day, means no swimming in the ocean, we had three of those days. That was unfortunate because the weather was phenomenal, sunny and about 30 degrees celcius each day. When it is windy beware of jellyfish, they're not like normal jellyfish. They float on top of the water and the wind blows them towards shore, cool looking though.
reviews.title: Great value for the money.

reviews.text: We were in Cuba from Feb 18 - Mar 4th. We arrived at the hotel early afternoon and were the only ones checking in, so it went quite quickly. Our rooms weren't ready so we had to wait an hour. When we were escorted to our rooms, we were delighted to see that we had been upgraded to an oceanview instead of gardenview. The room had 2 single beds and a large bathroom. The balcony was terrific for relaxing. The buffet was great with lots of selection. They had a problem acquiring wine while we were there, so you never knew when you were going to get any. I bought some wine at the local plaza ($5) and the servers at the buffet bent over backwards for me to open it and put it in a cooler with ice at our table. Sometimes, the service was lacking though. For breakfast they were slow at coming around with the coffee, utensils, etc. We tried all 3 of the restaurants and as mentioned before the Italian is the only one worth booking. If you do go to the International don't order the fish. It is served half cooked and even after sending back it still is half cooked.
reviews.title: Quite happy with the Alegro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is wonderful and the outdoor grill/bar is so convenient and yummy.
reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For, But Here Are Some Tips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our maid kept our room spotless and we left a peso + goodies for her daily. Near the end of our trip she became kind of lax with the toilet paper and coffee, so we had to leave her a note reminding her that we still would need them. We had some clothes laundered while there and had no complaints with the results.
reviews.title: New ownership making positive changes.

reviews.text: All in all we had a wonderful time at the Allegro. We highly recommend it for a quality hotel at a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Please Do Not Stay at this Hotel - Give them a least a year to make improvements

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Allegro Varadero March 5-12. I must admit that the main building puts a sour taste in your mouth, but as you walk around the the bungalows they are much nicer. Check in was very slow. They only had 1 front desk clerk to take on a whole bus load of people. We paid extra to take an earlier flight, which sounded perfect, we got into the resort at 12:30 but we didn't get a room until 4:30. But there was a bar that we made the time go buy with. The rooms standard. King bed separate bathroom, I thought were nice. The food is not too bad, I enjoyed the pasta guy!! Tip, if you love garlic with your pasta tip the guy there and he will give you real garlic rather than garlic powder!! Service at the bars (main pool bar & the beach bar and the pool bar near the a la carte restaurants was not that good. My MAIN TIP FOR ANYONE GOING TO THIS RESORT IS, When you are walking out of the main building (facing the ocean) Go LEFT!!! There is a poolbar that way with a beautiful view of the ocean, breathtaking view I might add. And the bartender there is awesome!! Tip him the first day and he will bring drinks to your chair!! There is also a little lunch there as well.
reviews.title: Park your expectations at home!!!
